intro: Amerimnon cujabense, commonly known as the Cuja River plant, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon Basin. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found near rivers and streams. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local ecosystem.
